title: BetaDelta Analytics & Research
text:
Chart better. Lead better.


Data Visualization Specialties

Building charts and tables you can actually understand.
Creating data visualizations you are excited to share.
Delivering situational awareness through Tableau/PowerBI dashboards.
Accelerating important business conversations by leveraging data more powerfully.
Scaling data visualization and reporting programmatically using R, Python, & SQL.
Organizing data and reporting using Microsoft Excel.




Investment Manager Research & Performance Measurmenet

Providing investment manager research & performance measurement support.
Driving insight using specialized investment data platforms like:

Morningstar Direct
eVestment
Strategic Insight: SIMFUND
Zephyr StyleAdvisor

title: Your Team
text:
I am an analytics professional with an investments, finance, & market research background. I am also a U.S. Marine Corps Veteran. My family and I call Franklin, Tennessee home (just south of Nashville). I have 12 years of experience at a premier, global investment manager T. Rowe Price and currently work full-time for Ramsey Solutions as a data analyst in the digital marketing and real estate business analytics space.

title: Our Mission
text:
Mission One
We provide simple, aesthetic, easy-to-understand data visualizations that empower leaders to engage, influence, and grow their tribe.

title: Our Mission
text:
Mission Two
We deliver world-class investment manager research & performance measurement to financial organizations who need additional support.

title: Portfolio
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.4.0      ✔ purrr   0.3.5 
✔ tibble  3.1.8      ✔ dplyr   1.0.10
✔ tidyr   1.2.1      ✔ stringr 1.4.1 
✔ readr   2.1.3      ✔ forcats 0.5.2 
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()

library(readxl)
library(ggrepel)
library(geomtextpath)


df <- read_xlsx("Growth of 10 Dollars Table.xlsx")

colorp <- c("#252525", "#969696", "#a50f15")

ggplot(df, aes(date, value)) + 
  geom_textline(label = "$10  a day invested monthly @ 9% annual growth.", 
                linewidth = 1, color = colorp[1], vjust = -0.5, family = "serif", size = 5) +
  geom_point(data = rbind(head(df,1),tail(df,1)), aes(date, value), size = 4, color = colorp[3], family = "serif") +
  geom_text_repel(data = rbind(head(df,1),tail(df,1)), aes(label = scales::dollar(round(value,0))), 
            size = 4, color = colorp[1], direction="both", point.padding = 15, nudge_y=15, family = "serif") +
  labs(title = "What habit can you change to save $10 a day?",
       subtitle = "Financial Coaching can help you change your life.",
       caption = "\n Data visaulization by BetaDelta Analytics & Research") + 
  xlab(" \n 40 years starting New Year's 2023.  You can do it.") +
  ylab("") +
  theme_classic() +
  theme(plot.title=element_text(size=20),
        plot.caption=element_text(size=8, color=colorp[2]),
        axis.title.x=element_text(size=14, hjust = 0),
        axis.title.y=element_blank(), #element_text(size=14),
        axis.text.y=element_blank(),  #remove y axis labels
        axis.ticks.y=element_blank(),
        axis.line.y = element_blank(),
        text=element_text(family = "serif") #remove y axis ticks
        )

Warning in geom_point(data = rbind(head(df, 1), tail(df, 1)), aes(date, :
Ignoring unknown parameters: `family`
